titlestmt.titleproper: International Society for Third-Sector Research (ISTR) records
A Guide to the International Society for Third-Sector Research (ISTR) records FA1838

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-01-01 05:04:47 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: International Society for Third-Sector Research (ISTR) records

physdesc.extent: 112 containers:111 letter document boxes, 1 legal document box

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The International Society for Third-Sector Research records are organized into the following series:

Series 1: General Files Series 2: Board of Directors Series 2.1: General Series 2.2: Executive Committee Series 2.3: Elections Series 2.4: Board Meetings Series 3: Membership Series 4: Conference Planning Material Series 5: Conference Programs Series 6: Voluntas Series 7: Printed Material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The International Society for Third-Sector Research (ISTR) records contain the files of Executive Director, Margery Daniels. A large portion of these records document ISTR's international conferences which were held every two years. Also found within this collection are by-laws, meeting minutes, strategic planning reports, membership directories, newsletters, and a complete collection of ISTR's Voluntas publications.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 5 years old are open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The International Society of Third-Sector Research has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the International Society for Third-Sector Reseach.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The International Society for Third-Sector Research records were donated to the RAC in 2022.
